Multi-functional Features: Another way to improve a chair is to add multi-functional features. For example, a chair with built-in USB ports or a cup holder can provide added convenience for users who spend long hours working or studying at the chair.

Sustainable Materials: Using sustainable materials in the construction of a chair can improve its environmental impact. This can include recycled plastics, bamboo, or other eco-friendly materials that reduce the carbon footprint of the chair.

Customization Options: Offering customization options can make a chair more appealing to a wider range of customers. This can include different colors, patterns, and materials to suit individual tastes and preferences.

Smart Technology: Incorporating smart technology into a chair can enhance its functionality and convenience. For example, a chair with built-in Bluetooth speakers or a heating function can provide added value to users.

Space-saving Design: A chair with a space-saving design can be particularly useful in small living spaces or offices. This can include foldable or stackable designs, or chairs that can be easily tucked away when not in use.
